document_title: Tetralogy of Fallot (Fallot 4): Causes, signs and complications
subsection_content:
Congenital heart experts recommend that there is a connection between Measles - Rubella and tetralogy of Fallot, so women need to be vaccinated against this disease before intending to become pregnant.
Before getting pregnant, women need to be vaccinated against Measles and Rubella to prevent tetralogy of Fallot
Pregnant women need to avoid exposure to chemicals and use of unprescribed medications in the first 3 months of pregnancy. In case of necessity, consult a doctor for advice and guidance. Research shows that mothers with tetralogy of Fallot can pass the disease on to their children, so radical surgery is needed to minimize this risk.

Tetralogy of Fallot is one of the structural abnormalities of the heart that affects the operation and quality of pumping blood to the body's organs. Therefore, sick children need to be examined for early detection, intervention and effective treatment.
